title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: Does the expression match any of these formats: $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x$$ + $$b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x+b\right)}^2$$, $${\left(a x\right)}^2-2a b x+b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x-b\right)}^2$$ ? Yes.

title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that $$49n^2+14n+1$$ as $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x+b^2={\left(ax+b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=7n$$ and $$b=1$$. We can factor $$49n^2+14n+1$$ as $${\left(7n+1\right)}^2$$.
speech: In this case, we can see that  49 n squared, plus 14 n plus, 1  as , parentheses a x  squared plus, 2 a b x, plus b squared is equal to parentheses, a x plus b,  squared  where  a x is equal to, 7 n  and  b, is equal to 1 . We can factor  49 n squared plus 14 n plus 1  as , parentheses, 7 n plus 1,  squared .

title: Rewrite the Equation
speech: We can rewrite  49 n squared, plus 14 n plus 1 is equal to 64  as , parentheses, 7 n plus 1,  squared is equal to 64 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(7n+1\right)}^2=64$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$7n+1=8$$ or $$7n+1=-8$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$49n^2+14n+1=64$$ has two solutions which are $$n=1$$ and $$n=\frac{-9}{7}$$.
speech: Therefore,  49 n squared, plus 14 n plus 1 is equal to 64  has two solutions which are  n, is equal to 1  and  n, is equal to, fraction, negative 9, over 7,  .
